topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.0: Obtaining the Patch Update Package

body.p: An HPE Helion OpenStack patch update is a series of images and scripts that enhance functionality or fix issues found in a previous Helion release.
Before beginning the update, obtain the patch update package using one of the two following methods:

ul.li: Using the Helion Distribution Network by connecting to the catalog.
Importing a local copy when there is no network connectivity or when the user would like to obtain the latest files that are not yet published in the catalog.

section.title: Downloading from the Catalog
section.p: To use the Helion Distribution Network (HDN) to download the patch update from the catalog.

li.p: Log in to the Sherpa UI on the undercloud.
Navigate to Admin -> Updates and Extensions -> Updates and Extensions.
Click Configure to authenticate to the Helion Distribution Network.
Provide the credentials if you have already signed up, if not, sign up by clicking the Sign up now link.
Select patch update file and click Download from from HPE Helion OpenStack product installation
The patch update file might take a long time to download, depending upon your connection speed.
When the download is complete, click this Publish button to extract the package contents into the undercloud repositories necessary to perform the update.

section.title: Importing a Local Copy
section.p: If you have no internet access on the undercloud or you prefer not to use the internet, you can download directly from the download site using a browser. Then move or copy the patch update file to the undercloud node.

li.p: Use a browser on a separate system that has internet access and navigate to: HPE Helion OpenStack product installation.
Log in using your HPE Web ID.
Locate the patch update file and click Download. You should have received and email with the patch update file name and location.
The patch update file might take a long time to download, depending upon your connection speed.
Use a method as appropriate for your organization to move or copy the patch update file to the undercloud.
Log in to the Sherpa UI on the undercloud.
You can find your password from the seed VM. Use SSH to access the seed VM and use the following command:
Navigate to Admin -> Updates and Extensions -> Updates and Extensions.
Click the Import button on top right corner.
Select the CSU patch update file to download.
Click Import to deliver the patch update file for further processing.
Once the import of the package is complete, click the Publish button next to the package to extract the downloaded package contents into the undercloud repositories necessary to perform the update.

section.p: Note: If you have published the same CSU multiple times, the Publish function will upload multiples copies of overcloud images into the Image Operations (Glance) service. You can delete the duplicate images by using the build_no property of the glance image.

section.title: Next Steps
section.p: Review the Prerequisites for information or tasks that need to be performed before starting the update.
For prerequisites, see the Update Prerequisites.
